Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX PLEASE UPDATE MY PHONE NUMBER TO MY FRAUD ALERT:XXXX Dear Sir or Madam : The sole purpose of this letter is to inform you I have been a victim of identity theft. I am further requesting that you block the following fraudulent information from my credit reports so that I can proceed accordingly with my file. Once more, I want to emphasize none of the information stated below relates to any transaction that I have made. 
XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX The items listed are clearly fraudulent ; therefore, I am requesting that they are deleted /blocked by name of source. In addition, A CRA must block the fraudulent information and the victim must be identified within four business days after accepting his/her Identity Theft Report. When it accepts the Identity Theft Report, the CRA also must notify the furnishers of the fraudulent information that the victim has filed the Report, that the Report states that the information they furnished Resulted from identity theft, and that it is blocking the information that they furnished. FCRA 605B ( b ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ) .III. A. Blocking Information in Credit Reports under Sections-605B and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) Under section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), both the credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) and the creditors, debt collectors, and other companies that reported the identity theft-related information to the CRA ( furnishers ) are responsible for blocking fraudulent information from appearing in victims credit reports, blocking fraudulent information from appearing in victims credit reports Please let me know if you need any other information from me to block this information on my credit report. 
Sincerely, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX  # XXXX DOB XX/XX/XXXX ADDRESS XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: Loan orginated in XXXX. It was a heloc with {$65000.00} line of credit/balance. I was told when applying the loan matured in 10 years and if a balance, it automatically converted to a 10 year amortized note. I was notified by XXXX XXXX in XXXX of XXXX via letter from their Porta Rico Headquarters that the balance was due in full XXXX of XXXX and there was no conversion clause. I asked why I had not been notified and was told it was my responsibility to honor the terms of the note. I made payments through XXXX ( I have all cancelled checks ) and paid the balance in full the end of XX/XX/XXXX. They are reporting to the credit bureaus that Foreclosure was started. I live in Florida. It was a Mortgage Note. In order to start foreclosure a legal notice must be filed with the Clerk of the Court ( Lis Pendens ). I verified that no filing ever occurred. I filed a claim with Experian and the result was the Bank claimed it was accurate. I called the Bank and discussed this with them and requested any copies of any Foreclosure filings or documentation. They claimed the account was paid in full and closed and there was nothing that could be done. Spoke with Experian again and they said that as long as the Bank reports this they can not remove it. I have no problem with them reporting the payment history as past due because of the balloon payment. I should have read the complete note at closing. That was my error. The reporting of Foreclosure on the credit report is making it impossible to refinance my home to replace the {$60000.00} I took from my retirement to pay them as soon as I was aware of the problem. Issue is : fact - they Never Started Foreclosure and the reporting that they did is false.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The reason I am writing to you is to state that Upstart is being inconsiderate, I have always been a loyal if not outstanding customer. Ive always considered it a priority to make all my payments on time. Unfortunately, I fell short of my own standards earlier this year, and I was over a month late in XX/XX/2018 ( payment reported as 30-59 days late ). Also, I had been carrying a sizable balance for several months but as I am writing to you now, I am in the process of paying of the balances on my Upstart account. their records will show that I had never been late with a payment until this unfortunate oversight. 

The reason for me to be off the schedule to make the payments is that I got married in XX/XX/2018 ( Proof of Marriage ). As a result, I travelled out for my honeymoon for a few days, having expected to be back in time to take care of my payments. Unfortunately, During the few days honeymoon, my wife fell very Ill and could not come back as planned. I wish all was well in our Honeymoon and had come back in time but now its too late for me to go back in time and fix the situation. This was not entirely my fault as I was not around to make payment. Were it not for this set back, I could have maintained my perfect record. I can assure you it wont happen again going forward. 

The reason for writing this letter is that Im planning to apply for a mortgage loan, and its come to my attention that the missed payment on my record could hurt my ability to qualify. I truly believe that it doesnt reflect my creditworthiness and commitment to repaying my debts. 

As a long-time customer in good standing, it would help me immensely if you could give me a second chance and make a goodwill adjustment to remove the late payment from my file that was reported in XX/XX/2018. 

Thank you for your consideration, and I hope youll approve of my request. 
I am attaching my travelling itinerary and marriage certificate for your reference.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: I am corresponding about my XXXX XXXX XXXX, which is a credit account/card administered by the Army and Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ). In XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from AAFES advising me that the garnishment would start, and specifically states " the amount of the indebtedness is {$11000.00}. I began corresponding with AAFES in XXXX about the debt as I had repaid what I owed, however my annuity was still being garnished. In addition to that, AAFES had garnished my income tax refunds. AAFES directed me to contact " XXXX '' their debt collection agency. I have never been informed in writing that AAFES has secured their services to collect the debt. Additionally, I am unsure of what role XXXX is playing as AAFES has the order in to garnish my retiree pay and AAFES has been garnishing my income tax returns, not XXXX. I sent an inquiry to XXXX and it took two separate requests ( longer than 30 days ) to get a response. In XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a letter to XXXX, courtesy copying AAFES about the balance on the debt. To date, XXXX nor AAFES has responded. In the letter which I will attach, I provided a letter from the XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) my pay agent, as well as copies of my retiree annuity statements showing the deductions. I demonstrated how the debt had already been repaid, in fact overpaid. I asked for the garnishments to stop, a refund for the overpayments, and asked for proof of XXXX authority to collect this debt since they are not a Texas business. XXXX nor AAFES has responded to this letter as required within 30 business days. Request assistance, prior to my contacting the FTC with AAFES reviewing the letter that was forwarded to them in XX/XX/XXXX, stopping the garnishment, stopping any future holds on my income tax return and refunding the overpaid amount.

Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
I had placed a dispute with all credit bureaus with regards of this debt. They continue to call me from XXXX phone numbers. My wife answered the phone and she told them that this account is under dispute and they have no reason to call and harass throughout different times in the day. I am requesting verification of this debt. 

Dear Sunrise Credit : I am responding to your contact about a debt you are trying to collect. You contacted me by phone, on many date and identified the debt as XXXX. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 

If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 

State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 

If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 

If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them. 

If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 

Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 

Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 

Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. 

Details about your authority to collect this debt. 

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 


I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. 


In addition to providing the information requested above, please let me know whether you are prepared to accept less than the balance you are claiming is owed. If so, please tell me in writing your offer with the amount you will accept to fully resolve the account. 

Thank you for your cooperation. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I do not owe Perfection Collection or XXXX the total amount of {$1.00}, XXXX for services that were never provided. The amount owed began after the major storm occured and after the lighting strike the home and burned the unit this was not any amount owed before this time. I'm asking for this to be removed from my credit report because XXXX  and XXXX have removed this from my credit report, however, Perfection Collection thought they could try again with XXXX and know this is back on my credit when it was resolved with the other two credit agencies. I did report this matter with XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX but they do not want to resolve this issue. Well as time went on we missed payments and had racked up credit card debt. In XXXX we received a foreclosure letter. We took money out of our retirement to pay up so we wouldn't lose the house. Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or about XX/XX/XXXX I received a two notices in the mail from BBVA Compass bank about two transactions of " Failed Scheduled Transactions ''. The notices are dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This triggered me to contact BBVA to find out about these transactions. These transactions turned out to be fraudulent. the information I was able to gathered turned out to be the tip of the iceberg. I was advised several ATM and Wire transactions totaling $ XXXXhad been completed over 30 transactions from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. 

The next day my wife and I arrived at the local BBVA branch to make a claim for the unauthorized wire and ATM transactions. At that time the local banker advised the profile on my account had been changed. My contact telephone number had been changed, on-line banking was added to may account ( note : I had cancelled the on-line account when my parents passed away. The BBVA records will support there has not been an on-line account since XX/XX/XXXX ). In addition, PIN numbers had been changed/updated or added without my knowledge or consent. I have only one ATM card. 

It became clear during my visit to the local branch someone had impersonanted my wife and the changes were complete. 

Based these facts I believe XXXX has a serious breach in there security and the responsibility of securing my funds or to vet any person who attempts to make the changes described above without the person " personally '' going to the bank. 

Let me repeat. Any changes made by BBVA was irresponsible, was not properly vetted and without my consent. 

On XX/XX/XXXX the personal bank assisted to report all Unauthorized phone transactions ( ATM and Wire ) we completed all necessary forms ( so I thought ) and Case Numbers for both the Wire and ATM Dispute claims were completed. I was advised I would need to return to the back to complete and notarize Affidavits for the Wire transfers. This was completed on XX/XX/XXXX. The affidavits were emailed to the fraud department before I left the bank on the 7th. 

This is were the nightmare begins. Since that day BBVA personnel had never been upfront and honest when asked the question ... '' can you advise how, when and what occurred on or about XX/XX/XXXX when a person who claimed to be my spouse either called in to make the changes above. '' No response. I requested copies of any telephone recording on the day in question involving my account. No reply. Denied. 

The second question ... " can you advise what your investigation will entail and when will it be completed. '' I have been provided a dozen different responses to this question. 

I have been lied to, had the phone hung up on me and been treated, not as a customer, or a victim, but as the accused. 

I have asked, if you are satisfied I am a victim, then why has my money not been returned to me and you seek your funds from the bank receiving the wire transfer ( XXXX XXXX  ) or from the entities who received funds from ATM transactions. The replies come from inexperienced personnel in The Who read from scripts and have to reach outside to " back offices '' for updates. Not once has a XXXX investigator contacted me to advise on XXXX part of their progress. 

I submitted a written complaint on XX/XX/XXXX to the president of the BBVA XXXX XXXX. I have never received a call or written acknowledgement from anyone! Also, we hand delivered a copy of this home office complaint to the local BBVA Branch in XXXX, CA. 

But it gets better. After two weeks on constant calling on my part. I was advised Provisional deposits would be made on XX/XX/XXXX for the unauthorized ATM withdrawals. Form letters dated XX/XX/XXXX were finally received indicating credits for each transaction was provided. The form letter requested a return of a Written Statement of Unauthorized Debit. The form did not include when the form should be returned. When I contacted BBVA on XX/XX/XXXX to question the amounts noted on the cover letter I was advised I needed to return the form by XX/XX/XXXX or the Provisional deposits added to my account would be removed. Again NO ONE advised when I met with the personal banker on XX/XX/XXXX or on any of the numerous calls that this form needed to be completed and why then if the form was needed would my account be created without first returning a form BBVA Compass so desperately needed? 

Well I had to create a separate Word document with the dates of all the transactions and amounts, because the form letter did not provide enough space to list all of the transactions. The word document, a copy of the XX/XX/XXXX form letter and its attachments were mailed on XX/XX/XXXX in the self-addressed envelope provided by BBVA. I wanted to scan and email the information, but when I contacted the number on the form letter, BBVA was closed on Saturday XX/XX/XXXX and I need to call during normal business hours XXXX XXXX. 

Thinking I had completed with everything BBVA required, I was shocked to received another form letter dated XX/XX/XXXX denying my claim and to advise ALL of the Unauthoized ATM I had claimed transactions were now considered Authorized based on their investigation and all provisional deposits would be removed on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I called the dispute department the morning of XX/XX/XXXX. I spoke to the representative and a supervisor and was told the Written Statement of Unauthorized Debit had not been received and I would have to start new new dispute and a new claim!!!!! BBVA would not open the same claim. In fact, and this is odd since BBVA is not open on Saturday the claim was closed on Saturday XX/XX/XXXX. 

As far os the Wire transfer claim I have heard nothing and I am insulted by the attitude of BBVA the lack of empathy for an innocent customer and a victim of fraud. 

I am pleading with anyone who will this. I need help. 

BBVA is not acting in good faith and fair dealing. BBVA and their personnel have not been truthful and have deceptive practices that appear to be focused on denying honest claims.

Sub-issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is about the business practices of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX located in XXXX XXXX, California and its staff who lie repeatedly and appear to be running a total scam. Trying to collect debts and demanding you pay them or they will threaten to sue you, put a lien on your house, they admitted to calling relatives we don't speak to -- -even though they had our number and we have lived in the same place for 8 years. They lie when they call and refuse to identify themselves, they demand your full name and SSN and Birthdate and when you don't give it they begin threatening you repeatedly. If you tell them you don't know what the debt is, they claim you are a liar and you are not allowed to get a word in to the point you have to hang up. If you write them ANY letters, they will claim not to have received them. 

When this company began contacting me they could provide me with XXXX  answers. They act like you are their slave and that they are the only people entitled to any information. They failed to provide me with very basic information like the original account number and name of the company claiming I owed the money. They refused to do any of this, they also have an incorrect last name, this is not the name I use, I will not give these people my SSN and they had the incorrect Birth date, and then changed the birth date to match the correct one illegally. 

I am not paying this debt since I had to do all the work myself -- -I have never had any credit with the business they are claiming which turned out to be some XXXX XXXX I have not been to since XXXX. When I had gone to this place I used an ATM card not credit to pay for my pet to get fixed and that does not cost anywhere near the amount these people are claiming. Also in order to get your pet back, you have to pay the bill and since I still have my pet its obvious I did. I moved not long after I last visited this place, and have since that time used a totally different clinic since XXXX. I have no line of credit at any of these places. 

My husband works for the feds and the constant attacks on XXXX caused our information to be stolen and used by unknown persons locally and not locally numerous times and we retain the statements from XXXX telling us we are victims. They too have recently conducted their investigation and ruled in our favor with regards to this debt. These people can provide me with NO information despite the multiples of times I have asked for it -- -all they send is a piece of paper that has an amount due and threatening comments about suing me, they have also sent me fake court documents and I took these to the court house and they stated they were FAKE. That's not legal, they also call and leave messages calling themselves " investigators '' that's incorrect as they are debt collectors. Its also not legal to state they are investigators. A few called claiming to be attorneys and told me they could garnish my wages. They send letters demanding you respond 7 days from the date on the headers, and then make sure to mail the letters the day before the last day of response, this way when you receive it -- -its already expired for response. 

The BBB gives these people a " C '' rating and I can see why. I took a trip to find out where this place was, but it appeared to be operating out of some elderly people 's hospital which didn't make any sense. 

They have called my house and when my daughter or sister answered the phone the man or woman on the other end called them " XXXX '' and claimed they were me. Calling these people or making any contact at all with them is a lost cause. They have NO information to share with me other than a supposed amount I know with no account number attached to it. Its not the first time some creditor has done this and I am sure it wont be the last since our information as govt workers is never secure. These people did not even begin contacting us until mid XXXX and claimed they had been trying to collect since XXXX ... the last phone call I received was a threatening call about how she was going to see me in court in XXXX, well past the statute of limitations for collection. I have asked for their business License and have gotten no response, I have searched for the names listed in the fake documents only to find said people use false or fake not full names. 

They are constantly playing games. Its getting very old and its obvious they are trying very hard to collect a debt they can not prove I own. No signature card, no correct Birthdate, no SSN, refused to give me the name of the original creditor, I actually had to find this information myself. I called the vet clinic and also went in and they had no record of any such debt from any time period. However, they also claimed they had no control over the bank they used to offer credit to people. They would not give me the name of that bank either. 

Their fake threatening court docs were signed on XX/XX/XXXX and claimed you had 7 days to respond ... the item arrived in the mail box XX/XX/XXXX way passed the 7 days dead line- this is also bad business practice and its the second time they've sent the same letter and did the same exact thing making sure you can not respond to them. It also still does not state the account number for this line of credit, it does not give a start date or an end date for it, and they added all kinds of other false charges to the debt. 

They contacted my husbands mother, a woman he does not have contact with. She is an XXXX and XXXX XXXX, these people shared my information with her, and she called my home and told me about it. My husband is not listed on this debt, so why was his mother who lives in another state contacted? I had not spoken to this woman in 15 years and have no intention of doing so ever again because of some company like this. I do not owe this debt, the very business claiming I owe it stated they had no record of said debt. I was also told by the XXXX XXXX that this debt is passed the statute of limitation for collections according to the dates they give, which change as time goes by. At no time did I ever take responsibility for this debt, nor did I ever state I would make any payments to them, they are so rude over the phone to my family members who live in my house that I will no longer speak to them at all. These people need to learn to identify themselves properly by not XXXX  about being " special investigators '' or some other such fake titles.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
The following companies made inquiries into my credit profile, inquiries that were not authorized by myself and after sending a letter to the company, they were not able to establish a permissible purpose or furnish a signed authorization by me to run my credit. 

This is an example of what I sent to each of the following companies : " Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is your formal notice to cease your unauthorized hard inquiries into my credit report and, a formal demand that you immediately contact the credit reporting agencies and credit bureaus, where your organization has made inquiries into my credit history, to have your illegal inquiries removed. Be advised that I will be checking my reports to ensure you have had the following unauthorized inquiries removed : Made on : XX/XX/2018 Made with : TransUnion To my knowledge, I have not signed any documents authorizing your organization to view my credit history therefore, your inquiry into my credit report violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 1681b ( c ) : Transactions Not Initiated by Consumer.

If you are in possession of any document that you believe authorizes you or your organization to make inquiries into my credit report, I respectfully request a copy of this document be sent to my address listed above so that I may verify its validity. Given the amount of identity theft, I'm sure you'll agree that verifying your information is in your best interest. 
Finally, assuming you do not possess inquiry authorization, I request that, after removing your unauthorized inquiries from my credit profiles, you also remove all of my personal information from your records and send me confirmation that you have complied with my requests.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have an account with Conn 's appliance on which I am financing several appliances. I have ALWAYS paid this account timely with no issues. 

In XX/XX/2018 I had a vehicle accident and was unable to pay the account. I called and spoke with several representatives and on one call specifically I established a payment arrangement to defer the XX/XX/XXXX payment and bring my account current in XX/XX/XXXX. A new payment date was established. 

I paid the account current on the agreed upon date. 

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act and additional advisory opinions issued by the Federal Trade Commission that states when a new promise to pay date is set and agreed upon by both parties that date is used to determine timeliness of the consumer 's payment. 

Seeing as how I kept to the arrangement of the promise to pay and paid on or by that date this late payment reporting on my report is invalid, inaccurate and thus unverifiable. 

This item is to be removed from my credit report as stated in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ; continuing to report this information is blatant violation of my rights as a consumer as they are granted to me.

On or about XX/XX/2019, my mortgage bank posted notice of trustee sale on my door. I have done everything up until this time, that was asked of me by the bank in a timely manner. Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/2019, I paid off my remaining mortgage balance of {$220000.00} through four {$50000.00} payments initiated through a customer service representative at Freedom Mortgage and a {$24000.00} wire transfer that Freedom Mortgage instructed I submit per the payoff statement they provided me. I went to my bank after receiving a payoff statement from Freedom Mortgage and sent a final wire transfer payment of {$24000.00} on XX/XX/2019. I was able to confirm everything was received through reviewing my account on-line with a Freedom Mortgage representative to confirm that everything was applied to my principal. Additionally, the representative confirmed on XX/XX/2019 that my account was closed out and my automatic monthly payment removed, as nothing else was owed. I took screen shots of the payments applied, as illustrated on their website. Then I received a letter dated XX/XX/2019 that indicated my pay-off was complete, my mortgage release documents were being processed and will be mailed to the County Clerk and that I should notify my insurance company and county tax authority to begin mailing statements directly to me. Additionally, I received a check dated XX/XX/2019 for my escrow ( taxes and insurance ). Then I arrived home from business & personnel travel on XX/XX/2019 and opened a new statement from Freedom Mortgage indicating I had a balance of {$51000.00}. I called Freedom Mortgage immediately the next day to try to understand what had happened. They indicated that my bank retracted a {$50000.00} payment on XX/XX/2019, and they re-instated my Loan account. They also added accrued interest and late payment charges. This story seemed far-fetched given my finance background, so I went online to review my XXXX bank statement only to notice that 3 {$50000.00} payments were pulled from Freedom Mortgage rather than the 4 I had authorized. As a result, I called Freedom Mortgage to tell them that something happened on their end since it showed they had collected all 4 payments but they had not pulled the last one from my bank. Then I set up a conference call with the customer service representative from Freedom Mortgage, my bank and I, as Freedom Mortgage continued to blame me and my bank for the mishap. Freedom Mortgage continued to tell me that I owed the accrued interest and remaining balance due. My bank told them that no fourth withdrawl of {$50000.00} was initiated by Freedom Mortgage, so Freedom Mortgage decided they would review the recorded authorizations they had on file with me & their service rep ( on XX/XX/2019 ). After reviewing the recording, they FINALLY agreed it was their fault and they will reverse the accrued interest. I told them I agreed that I owed {$50000.00} but no more ( no interest ) and they can pay my second wire transfer payment and any other fees to perform a 'second ' payoff. I requested a formal letter and payoff indicating that the only remaining amount I owe is {$50000.00} with no accrued interest or other fees, including that they will reimburse me for the second {$30.00} wire transfer I now have to pay my bank. Since this discussion on Thursday, XX/XX/2019, the payoff nor a letter has been sent to me to rectify the situation. I also had to place a stop payment with my bank to not pay the mortgage payment set to withdraw on XX/XX/2019, as I found out Freedom Mortgage illegally set up an automatic withdrawl from my bank after they re-instated my account on XX/XX/2019 without even contacting me to tell me they were re-instating it. I have been fully willing to wire the {$50000.00} as a final payoff but want a formal document from them stating it is my final payoff. Supposedly they are still 'working on it ' to resolve this issue ( since XX/XX/XXXX once they finally believed me ), but now I'm worried that I appear in 'default ' on my loan since I put a stop payment to Freedom Mortgage with my bank and worried my credit score will be in jeopardy, when ironically I was the one paying off my mortgage in full. Each day I talk with them, they ask for another day and they have not let me speak to anyone further than a supervisor when I ask to elevate the issue. I'm also filing with the State 's  Attorney General for my protection.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Thursday, XX/XX/2019 I called XXXX Nissan of XXXX about a vehicle I was interested in online. I spoke with a salesman named XXXX. XXXX and I negotiated price over the phone and I made clear my intentions were to make a down payment of {$10000.00} on the vehicle and finance the rest. XXXX had to get approval from his manager but in the end he came back and told me his manager approved the deal. 

Friday, XX/XX/2019 My wife and I drove to Nissan to purchase the vehicle based on the agreed deal. Our salesman, XXXX had stepped away to make copies of our driver licenses and print the paperwork. He was gone for a pretty long time and eventually another associate came over to our desk. This other gentleman begins to explain how he can not allow us to make a down payment on the agreed upon price of the vehicle because, " we wouldn't make enough money on the deal. '' I argued and pushed back because I was told the manager had approved the deal knowing my intent to put money down. In the end, I agreed to purchase the vehicle anyway, because I wanted/needed it. 

We eventually made our way back to the finance manager, XXXX to close our loan. I told XXXX what happened and he shrugged it off like it was no big deal and even said, " Oh yea we have a new sales manager out there who came from a dealership in Florida. He won't let anyone with good credit make a down payment. '' The next week or so ... 
I called Nissan USA Consumer Affairs to make them aware and they created a ticket so that someone could follow up with me. A man named XXXX called me and explained that since the dealership is privately owned they couldn't really do anything about it, but that he would send it to the dealership directly so they could contact me. No one from the dealership ever reached out for resolution.

We had a forbearance period on our mortgage loan due to superstorm Sandy. Ditech has now sent us a letter of default due to us being in that program. 

Our account now shows {$32000.00} in arrears which is impossible. At {$1400.00} per month in interest the total if any would be {$17000.00}. But we are not supposed to be in arrears due to our participation in the Sandy forbearance program. 

During the 1 year period we payed our monthly escrows. Ditech is still stating that we are in arears with our mortgage and they haven't applied our mortgage payments correctly to our account. They have not been applying it to escrows and keep doing escrow advances to cover insurance, MI, and tax payments. I found out this was the reason that we received a notice of cancellation for our homeowners insurance. Ditech was waiting for a managers approval to pay the premium as there was not sufficient funds in our escrow account due to their ( lack of ) accounting. 

Ditech has just transfered the servicing to another lender efeective XX/XX/XXXX which will make this even harder to solve with a company that knows little of what we have went through for the past few months. 

Attached is : 1. A letter from Ditech from XX/XX/XXXX requesting us to sign a mortgage modification for a loan term of 40 years where our address and information was changed to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, MO. 
2. A letter from Ditech from XX/XX/XXXX addressed to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, MO when we requested a payment history and why payments were not being properly applied.

I told them the bank account I used had been set up since the beginning of the loan, about 5 yrs ago and there had never been any problems with money being transferred into Flagstar until now. 
2. " The bank I used did not have sufficient funds ''. I forwarded my bank 's history record to show there were plenty of funds to pay when the transactions took place. 
3. " My banks did not send them the money because of " not authorized '' transactions ''. I had to forwarded my bank 's history ledgers to show my checking accounts had been debited which shows the money had been sent to Flagstar. 

Due to advice from # 1, I changed my bank on XXXX to 2 other banks to continue paying the monthly mortgage. Both had the same issue. So 3 of my banks had same issues. Flagstar kept reversing my payments with the same above excuses. I told them it was my banks it was their system. 
When Flagstar reversed the payments, the funds that my banks sent to them were never returned. My banks says they had sent the money to Flagstar but never received any notifications the money is being returned. In order to credit back the money my banks had to initiate their own investigation and perform a Dispute before my money could be credited back into my account. 

I talked to about 10 services reps and 2 Supervisors. None can help explain why Flagstar keeps reversing the payments. Each time this happens I get charged a Returned check fee. Because no one at Flagstar can resolve the issues and my money was taken from the checking accounts to pay Flagstar but was not returned when they performed a Returned check I decided to payoff my loan. I don't trust Flagstar to manage my loan anymore. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, I follow the payoff procedures and obtained the Payoff value from Flagstar. With the payoff, Flagstar confirmed my loan was paid in full and the Deed of XXXX was sent to me with an Escrow refund. When I cashed the Escrow refund check, Flagstar had put a stopped payment on the refund check and told me I still owe them money. If I don't pay then they will rescind the release of the mortgage/trust. 

Because of the many reversed payments performed by Flagstar I feel they still have not returned all my money and that they still owe me money. I can not get anyone from Flagstar to work with me on the accounting for the money. They keep passing me to other people and each time it gets more confusing and more paperwork is required. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX, I still don't have my refund money.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
Background : My identity was unknowingly stolen by a previous roommate who lived in the same household sometime around XXXX. 

It just came to my attention that on XX/XX/XXXX the individual set up a 5 year contract with XXXX for a home alarm account with both of our names as the account holders ( maybe for co-sign purposes? ). This location of the residence where this alarm account was opened is on the opposite side of the country. 

The individual made payments for 1 year and 8 months before the account went delinquent. The account then went to collections a little while later, and landed in the hands of the debt collector named Perfection Collection around XX/XX/XXXX. 

When I was contacted by the debt collector, I let them know that I did not set up this account, nor have I ever lived in the state it was setup in, nor on that side of the United States. I let them know that the individual 's name on the account was a previous roommate, and that he must've stolen my identity 15+ years ago. 

They responded to my deny of the account by saying they already talked to the other individual and he said that I stole his information to setup the account, and then implied that they are only looking for repayment, not looking to get me in trouble for setting up the account under his name ; which isn't even true in the first place. 

I continued to get harassing calls for payment. When I asked how to fix the problem, they did not provide any assistance ; their only interest was to get repayment for the account, and did not take into consideration that the account was fraudulently setup in my name. 

I had to make several calls to get info on how to take this off my credit report, because they were not helping. When I finally reached someone, they were hesitant to give me the information about the account, as well as hesitant about telling me steps I need to get it resolved. 

I filed a police report with my local police, and found more information on steps to take from IdentityTheft.gov on my own ; however, when I call them now they no longer answer the phone, nor do they return my voicemails. 

The delinquent account is still on my credit report, and seems as though they are only wanting to work with me if I were to just pay it off this fraudulent account.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I've had a credit card with Citicards for 15 years and have always made payments on time. 

Recently, I linked my account to another bank account that I ended up having issues with, and a few payments were returned. I always made a payment when I was alerted to this, and the payments were never more than a few days late. 

In XXXX, they called me to tell me a payment had been returned, and I immediately paid two months worth of payments due. I was told my next payment would be due on XX/XX/XXXX. I found out my card was then placed on a 30 day hold due to the returned payments - fine. I spoke to several people on the phone and no one told me it would be an issue in the future. 

Since I didn't have a payment due until XX/XX/XXXX, I didn't think anything of it. Then, on XX/XX/XXXX, they attempted to take a payment from my account through AutoPay ( my experience had been that if your minimum payment was {$0.00}, they wouldn't try to get a payment on the due date ). I called Citi and was told that they did always try to take more payments anyway, but that because of the misunderstanding, they'd refund my {$37.00} fee. I also asked if this would mean another 30 day hold and the customer service rep told me no, my account was fine, and I was welcome to use the card as normal. 

So I was very surprised when a few weeks later, I logged onto my account to find out it had been closed, due to " poor account performance '' aka the returned payments. If I had been warned at any time that my account was at risk, or had gotten TRUE information from the customer service reps, or they had even MENTIONED that a payment would be taken out even when one was made, I would have immediately paid off the whole account so as not to risk my credit score. Now, my 15 year old account is closed and my credit score is in the toilet, all because of some clerical issues with a bank account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello. 

I've been a customer of Wells Fargo for about five years in DC. 

Recently when I called the automated line they asked me to say my name in order to record it and use it for identification/security purposes. I don't feel comfortable with that because I don't think it's respectful of privacy and I didn't. They put me through to a customer service agent on that call. 

About a month later I called again and this time their automated system would not put me through without me saying my name. This was never asked of me in the past five years. I managed to get through anyway by pressing zero about ten times and made a complaint to them about requiring my name to be said and about trying to get and use my bio-identity without my permission. 

I called them again recently to return the call of their rep who had left me a voicemail. I had deleted the vm by mistake and forgot the caller 's name and this time they required me to say my name before they would look at my account or before they would speak with me. I refused and asked to speak with a supervisor and the supervisor also refused to speak with me without me saying my name. 

She then tried to get me to say my name in a sneaky way, by saying she needs me to say it in order to continue speaking with me and when I asked her if it was for bio-identity purposes she denied it but she would not settle for me spelling my name. She also engaged in other mildly sneaky or disengenous behavior I feel. 

I am going to close my account because this is a dealbreaker at this point but I find it hard to believe that this kind of behavior is legal. 

I would hope that you will prosecute them if it's not legal behavior. Would you please inform me whether what they are doing is legal or not? 

Thankyou very much, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I received a collection notice for {$59.00} from a Debt Collector named XXXX XXXX XXXX from car accident which occured on XXXX XXXX. I sought legal counsel and was told to forward any bills I received to my attorney, ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), who would notify the creditor, that the bill is in litigation, and would be paid from my settlement with the insurance company. I forwarded the bill to my attorneys office when I finally received it 6 months later in XXXX of XXXX. I called the creditor and advised them that they should contact my attorneys office if they had any questions about the litigation status, and provided a women named XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX with my Attorneys contact information. I noticed the item was on my credit report and asked XXXX what would it take to be removed. She advised me once she confirms with my lawyer that its included in the settlement, or if I pay the {$59.00}, they would remove it from my credit report. She said she could no longer speak to me and would need to speak to my Lawyers office. In XXXX of XXXX, I disputed the collection with all three bureaus and XXXX and XXXX, were given the go ahead to remove the item from both reports ; however, XXXX claimed that XXXX XXXX XXXX electronically advised them not to remove the item. My lawyer advised me that even though XXXX advised it would be removed from all three bureaus after their conversation in XXXX, she told me to just pay the {$59.00} and ask for a Good Will removal, since they already gave XXXX  and XXXX the green light to remove it. On XX/XX/XXXX, my Attorneys office contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX to find out why the collection wasnt removed from XXXX after being told it would be, XXXX advised my attorneys office to have me make a payment and it would be removed. XXXX gave my attorney the website to make a payment but said I had to call to get the security pin to pay online. Sub-issue: Impersonated attorney, law enforcement, or government official
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, a collection Agent for PHEAA, misrepresented themselves by identifying themselves as US Department of Education and offset by tax of {$3300.00} without Court Order. This alleged debt was a XXXX XXXX XXXX that was paid off but had been manipulated to create the current debt and was assigned to XXXX XXXX  for collection. 

Seeing the suspicious manipulation on the letter from the US Dept. of Treasury, I decided to dispute the Offset with the US Dept. of Education Ombudsman Group. The US Dept. of Education Ombudsman group showed that they did not offset my tax but said that PHEAA has the ability to garnished and certified my tax for Treasury Offset ( TOP ).

But the Law requires PHEAA to offset my tax only with a court order and PHEAA does not have the court order. GC Services, PHEAA 's Collection Agent, does not have court order required to offset my tax either, buit decided to misrepresent themselves as US Dept. of Education to offset and take my money in Bad Faith. 

I also found out that the US Dept. of Education also need court order to Offset this alleged debt because it was and is still disputed. According to the law US DOE can only Offset on undisputed debt without court order. 

This alleged debt had been disputed many times from XX/XX/XXXX but was never verified and never validated on collection accounts. 

I also disputed this alleged debt with GC Services when I received their collection letter, dated XX/XX/XXXX, in the mail. I asked for the validation of the debt as required by Texas Debt Validation process on XX/XX/XXXX but XXXX XXXX never validated the debt but continued to pursued collection action and still reporting the debt on my credit record in violation of the FDCPA. 

Returned certified mail confirmation showed XXXX XXXX received my dispute letter but never responded and never validated the alleged debt but decided to misrepresent themselves to offset my {$3300.00} and take my money in Bad Faith. 

The US Dept. of Treasury had said that only the person named in 'who do I owe ' can be able to remove, change and refund the money collected through this falsified Treasury Offset process. But the US Dept of Treasury had failed to identify the real certifying agent of this Offset.

Therefore TOP Trace # : XXXX  was certified in violation of the Federal Debt collection Act and has to be nullified and my money return to me. 

I am also requesting that my information be removed from TOP data base in accordance with the Federal Debt Collection Act due to misrepresentation by XXXX XXXX, the certified agent.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2016 I sought emergency care in a North Carolina hospital after an automobile accident. At the time I had hospital insurance with XXXX XXXX and also XXXX XXXX XXXX. When I received a bill from the hospital I called to question why I was being billed but promised to pay a small amount as a " goodwill place holder '' until I could clarify my responsibility.. Some months later, XXXX contacted me and took ownership of their insured 's liability and I erroneously thought that XXXX would pay all medical bills associated with the accident. I found out that the medical debt to North Carolina had gone to collections, thus spoiling what had been my stellar credit score of the years. 

As a new resident of Georgia, I was never able to find any lawyers to help me with any claims either because they did not practice in North Carolina or because my case was not worth their while. ( Moreover the timing of the accident presented any number of other issues piled up to complicate the matter. ) As I mentioned earlier, I had erroneously thought that XXXX would pay the medical bills that I had incurred. I have finally gotten a settlement offer from XXXX only to find that NC law does not permit XXXX to pay the debt incurred in the NC Hospital emergency department. The settlement leaves me with a diminished credit rating, the balance of over {$1000.00} in collection, and the unresolved question as to why the NC Hospital 's Billing Department did not first make a claim to my health insurers I think that this was an error on the part of the NC Hospital. I want to add that I received subsequent medical treatment through XXXX XXXX, for which liens were attached to the settlement and thus these bills will be paid by XXXX. The statute of limitations for the accident is just about to expire as far as the accident is concerned .. Because I am XXXX years old and have never had any credit problems, I had no thought of contacting you earlier and still do not know if you can offer any advice. Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: Hello, I recently came to the conclusion of the scheduled payments of a {$55000.00} auto loan provided by Valley National Bank ( Acct : XXXX ) in XX/XX/2018. Upon receiving the final payoff statement, Valley National Bank incorporated over {$1000.00} of late payments and fees associated with payments which weren't made on the exact due date of the loan over the life of the loan. I purchased my vehicle at a dealership and had I known that the financing bank, Valley National Bank, didn't offer online payments I may have requested another lender ( if possible ), but nonetheless over the course of my loan term I admittedly didn't always submit a wire request from my primary bank in time to have the funds to Valley National by the due date. So upon receiving the final payoff statement from Valley National which included {$55.00} of principal and {$1000.00} of late fees, I simply asked Valley National to provide me with a reconciliation of the {$1000.00} of late fees over the course of five years of payments so I could validate those {$1000.00} of late fees and/or additional interest. After being bounced around various departments at Valley National I was told by a collections XXXX that the statement had to be mailed and couldn't be made available online. As I waited for the mailed copy to arrive, I continued to receive collection calls on the remaining principal balance and outstanding fees ( daily over the course of 2 weeks ). I assured the parties involved that I wasn't declining to pay and would make payment arrangements upon receipt of the mailed materials. Over the next 2 weeks all I received from Valley National in the mail was further notices of the remaining principal balance and requested fees. At this point I called Valley National collections to again ask on the status of the requested reconciliation materials. I was told that the materials request was never made and that another department would have to handle reconciliations. Concerned, I asked to speak to a manager and urged her to please initiate the request for the materials so I could reconcile. I even offered to make a payment at the time for the remaining principal balance while I awaited the reconciliation materials so as to close out the loan without any negative impact upon my credit status. She assured me that no further collection actions would be taken, no late payment report would be made to the credit bureaus and assured me that the materials would be mailed over the next few days. Ten days later, I still had not received the materials in the mail and again called the company, at which point I was able to " get to a person '' who had working knowledge of the fee reconciliation system. Rather than asking yet again for the reconciliation to be mailed, I just had her verbally read the day count and $ fees associated with the various payments which weren't made on the due date over the course of the loan, at which point I agreed to pay the principal balance and fees in full, fully expecting that I would never receive a reconciliation in the mail. Days later I received the vehicle title in the mail and figured this was closure, however upon application for a refinance of my existing home loan ( XX/XX/XXXX ) I now discover that over the course of this whole ordeal, Valley National reported me as 30 days late two times for the unpaid {$55.00} balance, while all the while I was simply waiting for their reconciliation of late fees on the payoff notice to be provided to me. I contacted Valley National and asked them to please restate the report to the credit bureau given that my delays were related to an ask for a simple reconciliation of late fees over the course of a five year loan. Valley National declined to consider this and says " what is done is done ''. Is there any remediation that can be taken at this point. This is virtually the only blemish on my credit over a period of 20+ years and is now impacting the cost of my home loan refinancing. This feels like a classic case of poor communication between departments within a loan servicer, please help ...

Consumer complaint narrative: Im submitting this complaint with XXXX  because my credit score was negatively impacted due to XXXX   reporting a late payments against me. My credit report shows a late payment was reported during the month of XX/XX/XXXX. I was a loyal customer to XXXX ever since received my auto loan in XX/XX/XXXX and I always made my payments on time. XXXX either did not properly send a request for payment from my bank, or did and something prevented the money transfer to XXXX. I was never properly informed by XXXX about any impending or existing missed payments on my account for the month reported as late. I also never received any indication from my bank account of a returned item due to not having proper funds in my account to pay my bill to XXXX. I only found my original payment was not posted when I logged into my online XXXX account. I immediately paid my bill with my debit card and confirmed with my bank the following day to ensure the payment had successfully been transferred to XXXX. I'm only bringing this issue to the attention of others now because I did not know XXXX was reporting any payment as late to credit reporting agencies until I reviewed my credit report earlier this year. I have been negatively impacted when trying to apply for other forms of credit for over 4 years due to the late payment on my record caused by XXXX. Since this late payment is not the result of my wrongdoing, and due to the circumstances listed above, I respectfully request for XXXX to remove the late payment during the month of JXX/XX/XXXX. Please consider my track record of on-time payments as proof I take my financial obligations seriously. If you have any questions, or require further information from me, please feel free to contact me at your convenience.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/XXXX I applied for and received an online loan from BlueChip financial DBA XXXX. The loan amount was {$800.00} with 17 payments of {$130.00} totaling {$2200.00}. I made several payments totaling {$930.00} which was more than the amount loaned to me. In XXXX, I had some financial and health issues come up and I couldnt make my payments. Not knowing what the online lender could I contacted the Indiana department of Financial Institutions, the Federal Trade Commission and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. It seems that XXXX is NOT licensed to do business in the state of Indiana, charges illegal amounts of interest and does not recognize federal and state laws. Tribal law does not supersede state or federal law especially since Im not a member of the tribe nor do I reside on the reservation. BlueChip financial also violates the federal law against, deceptive and abuseive practices. Which in turn means that my loan is NOT legal, NOT enforceable and it is NOT collectible. Upon receiving this information I contacted XXXX via phone and told them what I was told. After that conversation I still received emails from them trying to collect money from me. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an alert from my credit monitoring app that a collection account was added. The account was reported by - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX In regards to the XXXX account. After making several phone calls I was told that XXXX sold my account to this company. I contacted XXXX and once again advised them that the loan was illegal thus making it null, void and uncollectableband that they needed to pull back my account from the collection agency. They said that a case manger would look into this. I wasnt given any time frame or even the persons name. I then contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX- I spoke with XXXX , who said he was the manager, he was very rude and basically said that they have money on this account and I needed to pay. I advised him that the loan was ILLEGAL making it null, void and uncollectable but he insisted that this legal for them to report this to the credit bureau. I have since then filed disputes with the credit bureau.
Company public response: Company believes complaint caused principally by actions of third party outside the control or direction of the company

I have sent Navient " My Loan Holder '' several documents stating the facts, all the documentation that is needed for loan discharge but I keep getting the run around and the generic Denial Letters. I believe that they are not investigating the situation. Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX : I received a notification from Credit Karma. It said I had a new report on my credit. Upon further investigation, I was about a hard inquiry that I didn't not apply/inquire about. 

It was by XXXX XXXX. The inquiry was for a XXXX XXXX XXXX account. Supposedly the inquiry was made XX/XX/XXXX. 

I did not apply for this, I do not know what this is. 

Credit Karma provided me with a link to call XXXX XXXX and have this taken off my account. 

I had first called the number provided at XXXX XXXX., XX/XX/XXXX and talked to a representative. He said I didn't have an account, therefore, he didn't have further instruction or ability to help me because there was supposedly nothing to look into. 

He ( XXXX rep ) said I needed to contact Credit Karma, so I sent XXXX  an email to their support on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX. Once I found out numerous people have never received replies, I figured I could call XXXX , seeing how that was the bureau that the inquiry was reported under. 

I called XXXX XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX. 
The representative gave me instructions for how I can get this taken care of, she even provided me a file number : XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

She instructed me to request a form/letter of release to be sent to my address. Which I would then have to send to XXXX 's XXXX. XXXX in XXXX, PA along with my letter of authorization. 

I called XXXX XXXX a second time, XX/XX/XXXX, at XXXX XXXX. I talked to a different representative, and he stated that this inquiry from XXXX XXXX XXXX was not affiliated with XXXX XXXX. It has no relation to XXXX XXXX, and they don't know why it would be on my credit. 

He also stated that Credit Karma has said that this was a common error, and they tell customers to call XXXX XXXX. He could not send me a letter of release because according to him, if I don't have an account with them then there is nothing to release. 

So then why would this be reporting on my credit report stating to be coming DIRECTLY from XXXX XXXX? It makes no sense. 

Therefore, sticking me into a vicious cycle of contacting whoever the last person told me to contact. 

After various short phone calls, I have no patience to wait months before realizing Credit Karma will never respond to me, and if they did, they would just tell me to contact XXXX XXXX  and the cycle continues. 

I did independent research and found someone who had that exact same problem as me, and this was the method he said worked for him. 

I need to file a complaint with XXXX XXXX, to take that report off of my account because that's exactly what they did for the man who shared this method to the internet. 

I need to file a complaint with Credit Karma. 

And I need to file a complaint with XXXX. 

I need my credit protected. I will be having my first child this year, and I need a house, and I can't get one with my credit sinking because a fake company wants to take money from me. 

Any help would be appreciated.

According to 1319.12 O.R.C.- ( 3 ) The assignment was manifested by a written agreement separate from and in addition to any document intended for the purpose of listing the account, bill , or other evidence of indebtedness with the collection agency. The written agreement shall state the effective date of the assignment and the consideration paid or given, if any, for the assignment and shall expressly authorize the collection agency to refer the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness to an attorney admitted to the practice of law in this state for the commencement of litigation. The written agreement also shall disclose that the collection agency may consolidate, for purposes of filing an action, the assigned account, bill, or other evidence of indebtedness with those of other creditors against an individual debtor or co-debtors.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Due to the defective escrow calculations in my mortgage, the lender increased my monthly payments by {$450.00} a month, beyond what I can afford. To correct this problem I am attempting to refinance my mortgage since the six month waiting period mandated by FHA has expired. This refinance is time sensitive as it has to be complete before the lender pays the next property tax bill this month which puts the escrow account into a negative balance. 

To make this happen correctly, I contacted Plaza to get the automatic draft of the mortgage payment from my bank account stopped and the tax payment delayed. I was assured both verbally and in writing that both of those things had been done, yet Plaza still drafted the payment out of my bank account. This has put the brakes on my refinance as it has totally changed the payoff amounts and affected closing costs.

I have been in contact with Plaza several times over the last two days since they did this and am getting nothing but run around. They promise calls back that never come and can not provide any explanation at all as to why they can not just fix their mistake. Their actions, whether spawned out of complete incompetence or being done out of a willful attempt to prevent my refinance so they can continue to collect interest, are going to cost me a substantial amount of money.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Ca XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, KS XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Re : Acct # XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I have previously sent you a request to validate my debt under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and all I received was an itemized list of the alleged charges you claim I owe you. This does not meet the Federal Trade Commissions guidelines of what constitutes proper debt validation In addition, in the case of XXXX Vs. XXXX ( IN THE COURT OF APPEALS OF INDIANA, No. XXXX ), the court ruled that : XXXX5 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ( emphasis added ). On XX/XX/XXXX, nineteen days after the date of XXXX debt collection letter, XXXX counsel XXXX sent XXXX a letter declaring that XXXX disputes your debt collection-related allegations, denies the same, and demands strict proof and verification thereof. Record at 21. As such, XXXX should have ceased his debt collection efforts immediately upon receiving that letter. Instead, XXXX proceeded to obtain a default judgment against XXXX on the debt collection claim before he had mailed XXXX the necessary verification and, thus, violated 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). 

XXXX maintains, however, that there was no violation of the FDCPA because he sent adequate verification of the debt [ to XXXX ] in the XX/XX/XXXX notice of claim. Brief of Appellee at 13. Specifically, XXXX claims that a copy of the consumer credit contract between XXXX and American General attached to the notice of claim provided sufficient verification of the debt within the meaning of 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). We can not agree. 

The contract in no way provides sufficient verification of the debt. A review of the document reveals that it identifies only the terms of XXXX loan, including a 17.99 % annual interest rate and the original loan amount of {$2500.00}. The loan agreement contains no accounting of any payments made by XXXX, the dates on which those payments were made, the interest which had accrued, or any late fees which had been assessed once XXXX stopped making the required payments. Indeed, the existing unpaid contract balance at the time XXXX sent the debt collection notice was at least {$350.00} more than the original loan amount. Therefore, XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) when he failed to cease collection of the debt by obtaining a default judgment against XXXX after XXXX had notified XXXX in writing that he was disputing the debt but before XXXX had mailed verification of the debt to XXXX. We reverse the trial courts entry of summary judgment in favor of XXXX on this issue. 

I notice that you are still reporting this collection on my credit report, which is considered to be a collection activity. You are now in violation of the FCPDA, and are now subject to fines of {$1000.00}, plus actual damages and attorneys fees, which I may collect from you by filing a claim in small claims court. These collections on my credit report are causing me severe problems in trying to purchase a home and the damage could lead into the $ 1000s. 

You should also be aware that reporting such invalidated information to major credit bureaus might constitute defamation of character, as the negative marks on my credit report harm my credit and prevent me from enjoying all the benefits of good credit. In addition, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) does not allow the inaccurate reporting of information on my credit report and under this act. Therefore, if you do not immediately remove this account from my credit report, you are subject to another {$1000.00} fine, plus punitive damages. I'm sure your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put your company in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. 

I intend to follow through with the suit if I do not hear back from you within 15 days. 


I look forward to hearing from you, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: We are being forced to file this Complaint because Specialized Loan Servicing , XXXX, hereinafter referred to as SLS, refuses to abide by the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, hereinafter referred to as the FDCPA and the California Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, hereinafter referred to as the Rosenthal Act. We took out a loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Due to a financial hardship in the XXXX of XXXX, we fell behind in our scheduled monthly payments. While in default an Assignment of Deed of Trust was executed on XX/XX/XXXX that purportedly granted all beneficial interest in the debt to XXXX , XXXX . as Trustee for a Trust. At the time this assignment was executed, the debt was contractually due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment. While still in default and due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment, the debt was purportedly transferred or assigned again to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX as Trustee of a Trust. At that time we had no knowledge of these transfers. On XX/XX/XXXX, we received a letter from SLS informing us that the servicing of our debt obligation was being transferred to them effective XX/XX/XXXX. At the time SLS purportedly acquired the mortgage servicing the debt was contractually due for the XX/XX/XXXX payment. Over the past year, we have learned that pursuant to the FDCPA and the Rosenthal Act, SLS and XXXX as Trustee are " debt collectors '' and not " creditors ''. They are threatening and attempting to proceed with a nonjudicial action to dispossess us from our home without the legal right or authority to do so in violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692f ( 6 ) and California Civil Code 1788.17.  Despite numerous letters to them, they have failed to validate the debt and have failed to provide us with any documentation to demonstrate they have the legal ability to attempt to collect the debt, collect the debt, or enforce the power of sale contained in the deed of trust. Although we have taken legal action against them, they have not stopped their collection and enforcement activities. We are filing this Complaint to make the CFPB aware of their wrongful and illegal actions. The California Supreme Court has confirmed that a borrower is not entitled to pay an entity that is without the legal right and authority to collect and is enforce. In California only a creditor, or an agent of the creditor, may attempt to collect a debt or collect a debt and/or initiate and complete a foreclosure action. Based on information and belief, we believe SLS and XXXX are not creditors nor are they representatives of our true creditors. Falsely representing that the foreclosure documents are legal process is prohibited and misleading and is in violation of California Civil Code 1788.16. Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is now my second complaint about this same matter, as complaint XXXX received a response from the debt collector and they admit to violating my rights under the FCRA and FDCPA. 

As I mentioned in my previous complaint, I was advised by my attorney to send a " Dispute/Validation '' Letter to them to validate the debt under the FDCPA and FCRA. I have attached the letter with my complaint. I mailed it " Certified Mail '' so that I would be able to verify that they received it. I have also attached a copy of the " Certified Mail Receipt '' so that you can see the tracking of this letter. You will notice that this was delivered on XX/XX/2019. Even though the delivery confirmation clearly shows that they received my letter, the debt collector did not send me validation, and instead chose to violate my rights under the FDCPA by the following : This debt collector has broken laws under the Fair Credit Reporting Act and did not address it at all in their response. Not only did they NEVER attempt to send me validation until I finally had to complain to the CFPB, but under the FDCPA Section 807 ( 8 ) they are in violation ( {$1000.00} fine ) as they did NOT notify the credit bureaus that these accounts were disputed. I pulled a credit report on XX/XX/2019 ( over a month since they received my validation letter ) and there are absolutely no notes from the creditor showing that these accounts were under dispute. I've attached that report to this complaint showing the dates, and the notes on the collection account. 

In fact, the debt collector admitted in their response to the other complaint that they didn't even submit the accounts to the credit bureaus until 23 days AFTER they received my dispute/validation request, thus violating my rights under the FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), FTC opinion letter XXXX from XXXX, This also carries a {$1000.00} fine. They did not validate the debt yet continued to pursue collection activity by reporting it to the bureaus, and continued to report to the credit bureaus. While I have the right to take them to court for violating these 2 laws, all I ask if for them to do what they should have done in the first place and cease all collection activity and remove these accounts from my credit reports, as demanded by law.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To make a long story short, there was activity with my bank account and through another credit bureau ( not equifax ) that i didn't recognize so i placed a fraud aleart/credit freeze on my credit through another credit agency. Heres the problem, i originally pulled all 3 of my reports but i never received one from equifax, i tried calling into equifax to ask why i never received a credit report but nobody wanted to help me, like AT ALL!! The only thing they kept instantly repeating is you need to send in photocopy 's of personal documents like drivers license, ssn card etc. I talked in over with a friend and they said they probably just dont have your information on file. I received a letter from equifax in XXXX saying " as you requested we successfully placed a fraud alert on equifax credit report. This alert will remain on your equifax credit report for one year ''. The letter then goes into how the frraud alert will be passed onto XXXX  and XXXX  and lists some contact information for equifax. Your probably already beginning to see the problems. Do i have a credit report with equifax or not? Id like an answer to that. If i do have a credit report then why did i have to goe through all of the personal document XXXX on the phone? please keep in mind, that doesnt go over well since someone probably stole my identity and someone from from equifax is asking ( more like demanding, Your welcome to listen to the recorded phone calls, i swear im not lieing! ) for photocopys of my personal documents for apparently no reason at all. I wonder how my lawyer would look at that. You cant blame me for saying that, Seriously, do you except me to say to that? Why did i need to send stuff in like AT ALL since i apparently have a credit report? And if i did then were is the original report that was Supposed to be mailed to me run off to? if i dont have a credit report then why did i receive a letter saying i did have one? If i dont have one then whos credit report did the freeze get placed on? Did equifax XXXX something up and label me as someone else, does someone else have my information? Even if equifax isn't at fault for that, is that the person that stole my identity and equifax did nothing about it even with a credit freeze in place? Imagine how well that would go over in court if that's true!

Btw, if i do or dont have a report is a different issue, The people on the phone have so far been stubborn with helping me so how do i unfreeze the report when ready because that seems like a bit of a problem? You probably got my point by now. Equifax just keeps digging a bigger hole for themselves here and im getting tired of having to try to make sense of equifaxes pointless XXXX. For once someone at equifax should FINALLY do their job. Im at a loss for words here so ill wrap this up. If equifax doesnt figure this out, at least partly then ill see equifax in court. i dont want to go that way but with the way equifax has treated me so far, i dont think id have another choice. WHATS GOING ON!!? Btw, if the person at equifax that receives this cant help me then please pass this onto someone that you think that can help me or even someone as simple as your boss, Id like to get to the bottom of this so please dont just ignore this.
